catalog_info.title: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science
catalog_info.notes: Covers material used in Computer Science 121 and Computer Science 124. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning.
catalog_info.description: Widely applicable mathematical tools for computer science, including topics from logic, set theory, combinatorics, number theory, probability theory, and graph theory. Practice in reasoning formally and proving theorems.
